data.title: So So Food
data.text:
Recently returned to Joe's for dinner on a Saturday evening before going to an event at the Arts Center.  The food was just so so.  Nothing bad, but definitely nothing great.  There were only three wait staff/busing folks, and that was insufficient.  We didn't get refills on drinks unless we worked at flagging someone down.  The restaurant didn't get really busy until after we had ordered.

The food came in a timely fashion (once the long wait to order was over), but I had to go hunt for someone to get the bill, and then to pay it.  We had 2 hours between arrival and our event, which we thought was going to be more than adequate.  Not true.  We walked into the theater with one minute to spare.

My wife had the gnocchi, which came in a marinara sauce that had a strong taste of some herb I am not familiar with.  Just threw the whole dish off.  The sauce on my chicken cacciatore (SP?) was  similar, but without the strong back flavor, but the chicken itself was pretty underwhelming, kind of like a carrier for the sauce.

The price was Ok, but the food would have to be better for us to go back anytime soon.

data.title: Average
data.text: Took over 2.5 hours for dinner - way overwhelmed staff. Food was fair, but not great. Had a table of 6 and tried many options for mains and deserts. Prices were good, but its just not worth waiting over an hour for the salad to arrive. Maybe better for lunch, don't know.

data.title: Best Italian Food in America
data.text: This place has it all -- excellent ambiance, great service, and the best Italian cuisine this side of Italy.  Have been here many times during our stay in Escondido, and have enjoyed every visit. Joshua is an amazing soul, a great server. We have enjoyed the Chicken Marsala, Lasagna, Clam Linguini, Cannelloni, Antipasto Misto. The food takes a while to arrive, because it's prepared fresh when you order it; but it's worth the wait!! The house Chianti is perfect, just as you would expect from a true Italian restaurant. Save room for the Cannoli -- and don't try sharing, because you'll want it all to yourself!

data.title: Neat small restaurant in downtown Escondido
data.text: Loved the ambiance in this small, intimate restaurant.  Was with a group of friends.  Food was Ok, but a little bit salty that evening.  Need to go back and try it again.

data.title: Dinner date
data.text: Average at best slow service, getting drinks, food, taking plates away even filling drinks.  Food ok will not be back

data.title: Been going to Joe's Italian Cuisine for years.
data.text: Very intimate cozy restaurant on Grand in Escondido. You might have to wait a little longer for your entre but it is worth the wait. Everything is made from scratch.  The waiters are friendly and try hard to please you. We look for the coupons and Tuesday through Thursday they can be used.  I highly recommend this restaurant. They also have an outdoor eating area.  We have never used that area et. Doesn't open until 4:30 PM.

data.title: My favorite Escondido Restaurant
data.text: Fun and funky atmosphere, excellent wine list, service is good, and food is always top notch.  Since I moved away and only come here for visits, I always have to make sure I have dinner at Joe's Italian Cuisine at least once. Excellent pasta and the red sauce is to die for.

data.title: Funky Place In A Funky Town
data.text: Downtown Escondido is a  funky little town and Joe's is no exception to that ambience.  We went early after reading the reviews that this place fills fast on a Saturday night.  By 6pm all of the tables were filled.  Good call!  So nice to have such attentive servers, always with smiles on their faces.  The food was excellent with large portions and homemade flavors.  Joe's serves only wine and soft drinks; no hard liquor.  My husband rated it as a good place to take guests--a good recommendation on his part.

data.title: the real deal
data.text: this is the place for hand made, authentic Italian food.  The place is and intimate- lots of clutter decor adds to the atmosphere.  It is really popular, so if it is a weekend, call for a reservation or be prepared to wait a bit

data.title: Very cluttered restaurant with great food
data.text:
From outside Joes looks like any Italian restaurant, but once you open the door ordinary cannot describe the inside, there is stuff hanging from every were.
The look of the place is not an indicator of the quality of the food.
My wife and I had a great meal, the food was excellent and the. Staff well versed in their job.
Well located and meals well priced.
Well worth a visit.

data.title: Love it
data.text: Joes is one of my favorites. The food is inconsistent as is service, but something about it makes it a must go, maybe the over the top Italian decorations, the old fashion family run feel, or the fact it's a neighborhood standard? But I always leave happy. Sometimes the eggplant is the best in the world sometimes good....but they do something right it's always packed. Thanks Joe!

data.title: Hidden gem in Escondido
data.text:
Joe's is a small quaint restaurant in Escondido--about 30 minutes north of San Diego.
This is gourmet italian food but moderately priced.  Owner/Chef has been in business at this location since 1980.  The  linquini with clams in white sauce (you can have red sauce if you prefer) was incredible.. Quiet, intimate atmosphere.  We spoke with a couple who have been dining at Joe;s for 25 years!  After dining there, I understand!

data.title: Good food and reasonable prices
data.text: Very good food and very traditional Italian dishes. A reasonable number of menu choices and all was prepared with good ingredients and good technique. The veal was cooked perfectly and the pasta as well. A fun and interesting place to eat!

data.title: Few places last this long
data.text: Local Italian Restaurant on a quaint street in Escondido.  It is small, but surprising able to accommodate lots of people including a small banquet room.  It is filled with Italian, old style.  Food is made now, so relax with some wine while you wait.  Staff is long standing, so no teens making it up. Expect a quality meal at a fair price.  Local have kept this place going for decades.

data.title: Cute quaint little Italian place on Grand Ave
data.text:
We had been told by some friends that this was a really good place for Italian in Escondido so we thought we would give it a try.  There is easy parking along the street nearby as it is conveniently located on Grand Ave in old town Escondido.

You walk in and it is small but charming.  The service was very friendly and inviting and the food was delicious.  Definitely support and give this place a try.

data.title: Italian food!
data.text: Awesome Italian food!  Great salads and amazing tiramisu.  Romantic atmosphere, quiet, convenient location.

data.title: The place to go for Italian
data.text: Joe's is a cosy place on the main street of Escondido.  Wonderful food and excellent wines, but also important are the marvelous and helpful young waiters and servers.  We had a delightful dinner with friends while visiting there recently.

data.title: Memorable visit
data.text: Ate here on a whim because our dinner plans fell through. As tourists we are always looking for local restaurants.  Excellent meal. Enjoyed the atmosphere. Gnocchi was superb. Great service.

data.title: Good solid Italian food
data.text: Always packed, Escondido tradition. Sometimes the food is off the charts delicious others okay. Service is stern order taking not much pleasantly, I guess unless your a super regular.  It's super tight inside and the decor attempts to feel like a Venetian gondola. Family owned and operated.

data.title: Mary G
data.text:
Great value, good service, we enjoyed the 
excellent fresh authentic food. Reasonably priced wine, old family atmosphere.
